009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
016import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
017import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
018
019import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * ImageJ plugin for a linear filter with a kernel of arbitrary size and integer coefficients (naive implementation).
024 * The filter kernel is a 2D {@code int} array of size (2K+1)Ã—(2L+1) with the origin at the center. The summation
025 * variable {@code sum} is also defined as an integer (int), which is scaled by a constant factor {@code s} and rounded
026 * to the new pixel value {@code q}. Note that the border pixels are not modified. See Sec. 4.2 (Prog. 4.3) of [1] for
027 * additional details. The kernel's dimensions must be odd and it can only be modified by editing this source file.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
031 * (2022).
032 * </p>
033 *
034 * @author WB
035 */
036public class Filter_Arbitrary implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
037
038    // arbitrary filter kernel of size (2K + 1) x (2L + 1):
039    private static int[][] H = {
040            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0},
041            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
042            {1,1,1,1,1,1,1},
043            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
044            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0}};
045
046    private static boolean NormalizeKernel = true;
047
048    /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
049    public Filter_Arbitrary() {
050        if (noCurrentImage()) {
051            DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.IrishManor);
052        }
053    }
054
055    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
056        return DOES_8G;
057    }
058
059    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
060        if (H.length % 2 == 0 || H[0].length % 2 == 0) {
061            IJ.error("width and height of kernel H must be odd ");
062        }
063
064        final int M = ip.getWidth();
065        final int N = ip.getHeight();
066        // normalize the kernel such that it sums to 1
067        final double s = 1.0 / this.sum(H);
068
069        // H[L][K] is the center element of H:
070        int K = (H[0].length - 1) / 2;    // K = 3 (x-center of kernel H)
071        int L = (H.length - 1) / 2;        // L = 2 (y-center of kernel H)
072
073        ImageProcessor copy = ip.duplicate();
074
075        for (int u = K; u <= M - K - 1; u++) {
076            for (int v = L; v <= N - L - 1; v++) {
077                // compute filter result for position (u, v):
078                int sum = 0;
079                for (int i = -K; i <= K; i++) {
080                    for (int j = -L; j <= L; j++) {
081                        int p = copy.getPixel(u + i, v + j);
082                        int c = H[j + L][i + K];
083                        sum = sum + c * p;
084                    }
085                }
086                int q = (int) Math.round(s * sum);
087                // clamp result:
088                if (q < 0) q = 0;
089                if (q > 255) q = 255;
090                ip.putPixel(u, v, q);
091            }
092        }
093    }
094
095    private int sum(int[][] A) {
096        int sm = 0;
097        for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
098            for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
099                sm = sm + A[i][j];
100            }
101        }
102        return sm;
103    }
104
105}
